title: ncdu command causes runtime error: slice out of range
body:
I've found a crash issue with the ncdu command.

If I run it on my google drive, it loads the screen and starts doing a background list. If I move to an empty directory and then press the up arrow, rclone crashes with the below error.

I have a debug log as well, but it doesn't show anything more than the usual Google drive rate limiting etc.


> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
**1.38 and tested with latest beta**

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
**Ubuntu x86_64**

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
**Google Drive**

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
**rclone ncdu GD:/**

> A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

